meanings.definition: A person who engages in stonewalling tactics.
meanings.sent1: The stonewallers in the meeting remained silent and avoided answering any questions.
meanings.sent2: The stonewallers at work always shut down discussions when asked for feedback.
meanings.sent3: The stonewallers in the group chat pretended to be invisible whenever a decision needed to be made.
meanings.sent4: Dealing with the stonewallers was like trying to break through a solid wall of silence.
meanings.sent5: The image of the stonewallers standing motionless, blocking progress, stuck in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: Those who refuse to communicate or cooperate in a conversation or negotiation.
meanings.sent1: During the debate, the stonewallers simply refused to engage in any discussion.
meanings.sent2: The stonewallers in the team project made collaboration impossible with their silence.
meanings.sent3: The stonewallers at the party turned into statues whenever someone tried to involve them in a game.
meanings.sent4: Trying to get information from the stonewallers was like trying to squeeze water from a rock.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the stonewallers' unyielding resistance lingered long after the meeting ended.
